metadata.Title: CVE-2022-44267 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ImageMagick 7.1.0-49 is vulnerable to Denial of Service. When it parses a PNG image (e.g., for resize), the convert process could be left waiting for stdin input.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44267` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
imagemagick-6-common - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
imagemagick-6.q16hdri - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
imagemagick-common - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libimage-magick-q16hdri-perl - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagick++-6.q16-8 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagick++-6.q16hdri-8 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickcore-6.q16-6 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickcore-6.q16-6-extra - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-6 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-6-extra - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickwand-6.q16-6 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
libmagickwand-6.q16hdri-6 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
perlmagick - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu11.5').
